content:
The Octoberfest will take place October 29-30 on Zoom, and you can get a Zoom link here.

The organizers is Richard Blute.

And here is a schedule of talks. All times are in Eastern Daylight Time (EDT). Thatâ€™s UTC-4.

SATURDAY, October 29

9:00-9:30 Bob Pare
9:35-10:05 J.S. Lemay
10:10-10:40 Ettore Aldrovandi

10:40-11:00 BREAK

11:00-11:30 Nils Carqueville
11:35-12:05 Cherradi El Mehdi

12:05-2:00 LUNCH

Special Session In Honor Of Pieter Hofstra

2:00-2:30 Jaap Van Oosten
2:35-3:05 Robin Cockett
3:10-3:40 Jason Parker

3:40-4:10 BREAK

4:10-4:40 Jonas Frey
4:45-5:15 Steve Awodey

SUNDAY, October 30

9:00-9:30 Christian Williams
9:35-10:05 Nathanael Arkor
10:10-10:40 Amartya Shekhar

10:40-11:10 BREAK

11:10-11:40 Jarl Taxeras Flaten
11:45-12:15 Egbert Rijke
12:20-12:50 Sacha Ikonicoff

12:50 END OF CONFERENCE
Not to complain, but I'm curious: why is it happening over a weekend?

I guess you should ask Rick Blute. I guess they were traditionally held on weekends, maybe so people could drive to them and not skip work.

(I have nothing to do with this conference; I just saw it being announced somewhere and thought it would be good to announce it here.)
